sections.markdown:
This Notebook is your step-by-step guide through our hands-on exercises on creating a custom Dynatrace app and query Grail data.

## Create a Copy of this Notebook
Notebooks are a great way to collaborate, to take notes and to explore. As this is a read-only Notebook please create a COPY of this Notebook so you can make your own notes and upload this notebook to your app shell.

## Project requirements:
- Node.js in the latest LTS version
- IDE of your choice
- Dynatrace Environment

**Links to external resources**:
You can find a full example in our GitHub repository [Our repository on GitHub]()

## Getting started with Dynatrace app

To initialize the application run the `create` command: 

```bash
npx dt-app@latest create --environment-url <your-env-url> --template empty
```

The Dynatrace App Toolkit will ask you to install the dt-app package and to name your app. Next, go to the app's root directory by running `cd <your-app-name>` in the terminal and start the development server by running the following command:

```bash
npm run start
```

## Query Grail and visualize in the notebook

Once you have your data ingested in Grail you can query the data and display results directly in the notebook:

input.value:
fetch bizevents
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates"

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch bizevents
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" AND type == "currency.rates"
grail.query:
fetch bizevents
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates"

input.value:
fetch bizevents
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates"

sections.markdown: To be able to use the other visualisation we need to add couple more filters:

input.value:
fetch bizevents
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates" 
| parse data, "JSON:newData" | fieldsAdd time = timestampFromUnixSeconds(newData[timestamp]) 
| summarize total=count(), by: { date=bin(toTimestamp(time), 12h), currency=newData[currency], currencyRate=newData[rate] } 
| fields timeframe=timeframe(from:date, to:date + 1min), currency=currency, currencyRate=currencyRate

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 3d, to:now()
| filter source == "CurrencyLayer" AND type == "currency.rates"
| parse data, "JSON:newData"
| fieldsAdd time = timestampFromUnixSeconds(newData[timestamp])
| summarize by:{date = bin(toTimestamp(time), 12h), currency = newData[currency], currencyRate = newData[rate]}, total = count()
| fields timeframe = timeframe(from:date, to:date + 1m), currency = currency, currencyRate = currencyRate
grail.query: fetch bizevents, from: now()-3d, to: now() | filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates" | parse data, "JSON:newData" | fieldsAdd time = timestampFromUnixSeconds(newData[timestamp]) | summarize total=count(), by: { date=bin(toTimestamp(time), 12h), currency=newData[currency], currencyRate=newData[rate] } | fields timeframe=timeframe(from:date, to:date + 1min), currency=currency, currencyRate=currencyRate

input.value: fetch bizevents, from: now()-3d, to: now() | filter source == "CurrencyLayer" and type =="currency.rates" | parse data, "JSON:newData" | fieldsAdd time = timestampFromUnixSeconds(newData[timestamp]) | summarize total=count(), by: { date=bin(toTimestamp(time), 12h), currency=newData[currency], currencyRate=newData[rate] } | fields timeframe=timeframe(from:date, to:date + 1min), currency=currency, currencyRate=currencyRate
